He was also upfront and honest about the upstairs neighbor’s noisy dog but provided ear plugs in case it was a disturbance.

The house is very close to the main streets, lovely neighborhood. Quiet, peaceful and beautiful.
Thank you guys!

name: Andrew
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I rented this for an 80+ year old family member who visited us over the holidays and wanted their own private space to retreat to at the end of their day. The host was very gracious and friendly. They proactively checked in on the temperature of the room when my relative arrived (it can not be controlled from the rental area), which was great because we had just been hit with an ice storm. They also had the stairs in front of the house shoveled and salted before we arrived. It was really a good set up for my relative - easy to get around, but I did need to escort them up the front stairs because they were pretty steep. The rental came with more amenities than we had expected, which was a nice surprise. I'd definitely recommend this for anyone visiting the Kingston area who wants to be in a casual place and within walking distance of some great restaurants, shops and entertainment.

review_text:
This spacious first floor apartment is nestled right in the stockade area, just steps from all the uptown action. The apartment was incredibly comfortable. Interior furnishings were of a modern interior design, and in lovely Victorian building with plenty of greenery for those while love plants. Other deets:
-big a/c unit to beat the heat and sleep in the cold
-huge super comfy bed with big tv placed in front of it, just like you’re at a hotel
-nice big kitchen with appliances, pots, pans, utensils
-a few cute little surprises to truly make you feel welcome.
-great water pressure in the shower too (honestly!)
Literally couldn’t have been any more perfect. No wonder they have super host status! Thank you Kaz!

The apt has the coolest floor-level night lights I’ve ever seen, though the kitchen could use a lighting upgrade, if you intend to prep food or plan your trip in that spot. Most o the fixtures are original to the house era, but plenty of new touches in the place. Easy parking spot next to the porch stairs, valuable in the neighbohood.

The bed is comfortable, bathroom and outside terrace with rocking chair are excellent. The guesthouse is sparkling clean, unique and very quiet.
The communication was super easy and quick and the place looks exactly like it does on the pictures.
The neighborhood is very conveniently located, we loved the book-coffee shop few steps down the street.
Would totally recommend to stay there!

The check-in procedure was clearly described; we had no problems accessing the guest house, and we also felt safe due to the double-entry system, both with electronic locks requiring codes to enter. Overall, we had a great experience staying at Kaz and Nat's property!

review_text: Great Airbnb in an amazing location in Kingston. The hosts are also great - very responsive and communicative, and they even brought us umbrellas when an unexpected rainstorm blew in! The one downside is that the apartment is a bottom-floor unit, so you do get noise from the upstairs neighbors walking around. This wasn't anything crazy, but might not be ideal for any light sleepers out there. Overall though we loved both the unit and the location, and would definitely stay here again.

I hope we can come back and stay again in the future!

review_text: Kaz's place was the best! The studio-style apartment, on the ground floor of a two-floor house in Uptown, was everything we needed, hoped for, and more. It's a five-minute walk (in a very walkable neighborhood!) to all of the restaurants, bars, cafes, and stores of Uptown, Kingston, not to mention the farmers market on Saturdays. The best thing about staying at Kaz's was how comfortable and aesthetically pleasing the space was - the decor and all the little touches (like a few snacks which were there upon our arrival) made it feel luxurious and homey at the same time. Kaz is right that some noise does travel between floors, so we could hear the upstairs neighbor watching tv and moving about at times during the evening, but it didn't bother us too much during our stay, and was totally expected in an older building : ) This place is such a wonderful deal for the area, and we will definitely look to stay at Kaz's again the next time we are in Kingston!

review_text: Kaz and Nat’s place is amazing and I cannot recommend the place enough! It’s a very large space for two, a very short distance walk to all the best restaurants, cafes and bars and the home is filled with lovely and very thoughtful touches. Everything is very organized and clean and you don’t have to worry about overpacking as they have everything from a fully stocked kitchen, to extra snacks (the Pocky was a lovely touch!) and the bathroom was very nice and came stocked with toiletries. There is ample street parking as well, and the street is very quiet and peaceful (great if you’re looking for a relaxing getaway). It’s also within driving distance to a few great hiking trails/parks, a local brewery (Kingston Standard Brewing) and a few farmer’s markets. 100% would recommend and we can’t wait to visit Kingston again and stay at Kaz and Nat’s place!

review_text:
The guesthouse was totally adorable, loved the mid-century modern touches, and it is the perfect size for a couple! Kaz & Nat were super nice and accommodating. The location is perfect since it's a minute walking from Historic Uptown Kingston with lots of restaurants, bars, shopping to do. PLUS with a car, you're within 15-30min of some great hiking trails, and a bunch of the other Hudson Valley towns.
My BF and I have visited all around the Hudson Valley, and Kaz & Nat's guesthouse is one of the best places we've stayed in considering location, price, and coziness! We worked from the guesthouse for a day and spent the weekend exploring town and hiking, there were so many places we didn't have time to see! We'll definitely be back!

review_text: I will try to keep this short and sweet because there are so many wonderful things I can say about this humble abode. From the moment you walk through the door you are greeted with sunlight in the living room with an open area connected to the bedroom. Trust me, the pictures that you see, don't do the home justice. Everything in the home was well tidy and clean and you can just tell that you're going to enjoy your stay. This house is in the perfect location of walking distance to great coffee shops. Uptown coffee and Outdated Antiques Cafe were our favorites. PAKT is a little pricey but they have the best chicken and waffles I've had in a while. For dinner, I recommend La Florentina (6 min drive) and Vincenzos Pizzaria & Ristorante walking distance of the home. Lastly, on the last day we had forgotten our bag. Both Kaz & Nat were so courteous that sent it back to us which i can't thank enough for! This was one of the best Airbnb experiences we've had thus far and would definitely come back if we came back to Kingston, no questions asked! Thank you Kaz & Nat for having such a beautiful home and allowing us to stay. Happy New Year!

name: Fei
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2020
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
This gonna be the most extended review I’ve ever written before because I looooove this place as well as the hosts Kaz and Nat! You can treat this review as a love letter to them and their lovely apartment! I moved from the city to Kingston and stayed at their place for 2 months. This place is too good to be true!
Communication: the communication with Kaz and Nat was very smooth and easy. They replied to me within 10 min, even though I contacted them around midnight. They addressed all my concerns and answered all my questions. They even send me pictures of the parking sign to me before I arrived.
Price: the price is super reasonable! There are many Airbnb in this neighborhood, but this one has the best price. Kaz told me he wants to set a price which he would like to stay as a customer himself.
Location: great location! It’s a quiet residential area, but close to everything! 10-minute walk to supermarket, gym, laundromat, different restaurants, coffee shops, farmer’s market (open on Saturday morning during summertime), and bank.
Apartment: It’s a very tidy and lovely studio equipped with everything you need. They have different kinds of tea and coffee available. Water, saltzer, and even kombucha are available in fridge. The place is very clean; even the sink strainer is spotless. Kaz and Nat have great taste in terms of decoration! You can tell from the details how much effort they have put in this place. There are multiple pieces of furniture made by hosts themselves (amazing!). The bed, like many comments mentioned, is the comfiest ever!
Parking: free street parking with many available spots, but you need to change side of the street following the parking sign day-by-day. Monday, Wednesday, and Friday are one side; Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday, and Sunday are the other side of the street.
Host: I can’t say enough about them. They always try their best to help me and respond to all of the requests very quickly! I came to Kingston without knowing anyone here, but they make me feel I’m home.
Stay at this place!! You will like it for sure!

When I got the airbnb, it was a little chilly and they immediately turned the heat up for me. I asked for an early check-in and late check-out and it was accommodated so easily! They were great communicators and super helpful. I will absolutely be staying here again if I visit Kingston another time.

review_text: Our stay at Atsuko & Satoru's guesthouse was fantastic - great location with cafes, restaurants, and bars within walkable distance while feeling safe even at night. The kitchen and bedroom were spotless, and we loved the Muji aroma diffuser, selection of teas, amazing coffee, and plenty of snacks/drinks provided for the stay. It got a little chilly at night and the ceiling can be a little creaky, but otherwise, this was the perfect place for a getaway! Thank you and we hope to be back again.

One minor disappointment was that I think they forgot to restock the coffee. I read rave reviews about the coffee, and so I didn’t throw any in my bag. They have a beautiful pour-over setup and I was sad that I couldn’t use it 😂 A “first world problem” for sure. Luckily, there are some great coffee shops nearby, and I started my day with some nice caffeinated tea at the apartment for a change.

This was exactly what I needed, and I would book even for a longterm stay in the region - everything is set up for comfort and convenience, with a well-stocked kitchen, coffee service, even some delicious snacks and drinks in the fridge... Atsuko and Satoru are warm and thoughtful hosts - immediately responsive and accommodating. I can't recommend this stay enough! Thank you!!

host was super easy to communicate with
accepted my last minute request within minutes
and had no problem with me checking in a little bit late in the evening.
The house is well lit from the outside and in a very clean and safe area.
Location is superb you are in walking distance of everything!
thoughtful touches throughout the apartment which I found to be extremely spacious well lit and spotless.
The bed was super comfortable The hosts left a very thoughtful bowl of snacks on the table which was much needed since I had worked the entire day made a last minute decision to head up and hadn't eaten at all .
Extremely tastefully decorated.
the house itself is large and colorful and has a few apartments within but I didn't hear anyone
no one above me and no one next to me! Well insulated. at one point I was fantasizing that I lived there.
Do yourself a favor, book more than two nights you're not going to want to leave!

Also had the pleasure of meeting Atsuko and Satoru one afternoon going into the house and they are a lovely and attentive couple! Have stayed at many places in the area and this is by far the best for us. I know they have other units in the same vintage building and i may check out one of those two. review_text:
Atsuko and Satoru's apartment is, by far, the BEST airbnb I have ever stayed at!
It's extremely clean, super spacious, with outstanding amenities. It has everything one would need.
It is the perfect location in uptown, Kingston. It is quiet yet near to wonderful shops, restaurants and beautiful old churches. It is private yet centrally located.
The appliances are top of the line. The kitchen is fully appointed and there are many thoughtful touches, with snacks and ample tea and coffee selection.
There is a parking space and laundry facilities.
Atsuko and Satoru are totally accessible, gracious and very generous hosts.
I actually arrange my travel so that I may stay at their place when traveling in the region.
It is a truly exceptional place to stay and I can't wait to return!

The location was perfectly convenient. We were walking distance from so many wonderful things in Kingston – restaurants, cafes, bookstores, music venues, shops and historic buildings. We were happy to be able to walk to all of our destinations. My daughter had a wonderful time playing her Viola in the space as the acoustics were lovey with the high ceilings. We would definitely contact this AirBnB again when we find ourselves visiting the Hudson Valley. We rate this Air BnB top of the list!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This was our second trip to Kingston and we loved it more this time because we stayed in Uptown Kingston, which is really the place to be. This apartment was in the heart of upstate, walking distance (3 to 6 minutes) from everything, and only a 20 min drive to Rheinbeck, across the Hudson. The apartment was not only squeaky clean, and beautifully decorated, but there were also many small details that made it extra special: as a tea drinker, I really appreciated the great assortment of teas and honey (usually, I always have to buy or bring my own), they also had great drip coffee, which my husband enjoyed. The master bed was amazingly comfortable and cozy, and the living room was equipped with Roku television. This was a trip for pleasure but we made note of the desks in each of the rooms which will come in handy when we return to work remotely from Kingston! All in all, we had a great time, and recommend Atsuko and Saturo’s properties to all. We will certainly rent from them again!

review_text: This was a beautiful apartment with lots of character and antique details. It was super clean and well appointed with great pillows and soft sheets and all the other amenities. Atsuko and Satoru have put a lot of thought into the place and have made it very comfortable for guests. There were fresh towels in baskets in both bedrooms and nice slippers in the closet. Location was perfect for exploring Kingston. It was a comfortable walking distance from the shops and restaurants that I wanted to go to. It's a great place to stay if you have multiple guests in your party as it is a large apartment. Honestly it was probably too big for me, as I was traveling alone. One note - I didn't notice until the day of my trip that the check in time isn't until 5pm. which seems a little late and I would have preferred to access the space sooner. I know it was in the original booking information but I guess I'm accustomed to earlier check in time - 3 or 4pm. All in all though, a very nice stay.

Nearly every detail was thought of and it's very conveniently located in walkable uptown Kingston with parking provided. There is one exterior stairs and one longer interior set of stairs to reach the apartment, but loading in from the street (not the parking lot behind the building) was a breeze. review_text: I can't say enough great things about this apartment. The location is fantastic - 5 minutes walk (or less) to wonderful restaurants, bars, coffee shops, bakeries, shops, lovely spots to work remotely...really everything you could need. The apartment is even more spacious than the photos suggest with great light and lots of charm. We wanted to pack up the entire bed - mattress, pillows, sheets, everything - and take it home with us. We settled for taking note of where the linens, etc. were purchased and adding them to our holiday lists. While street parking wasn't competitive, having the dedicated parking spot added extra peace of mind, and there were thoughtful touches like a humidifier with relaxing essential oils and Japanese snacks (who doesn't love an Airbnb that comes with Pocky??) In summary, this is a wonderful, spacious and comfortable apartment in easy walking distance to some of the most beloved spots in Kingston - highly recommend.

I loved staying at the Bau Guesthaus . It’s beautiful and thoughtfully designed, with very comfortable beds and linens. Satoru and Atsuko have created a special experience here, even things you didn’t know you needed have been thought of.
The location is perfect and walking distance to many nice restaurants. We had brick oven pizza at Lola’s just a block away, very nice. Outdated cafe is always good for breakfast. We will definitely be back again:)

name: David
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: This is a wonderful, large, and well-appointed apartment. The owners are artists and the interior decorations reflect this--interesting lighting and antique furniture, including a clawfoot bathtub, albeit with a modern shower head. They also left an assortment of interesting, Japanese snacks and seltzers in the large, fully equipped kitchen. The beds were also very comfortable. The upstairs apartments are up a very steep set of stairs, so be prepared to work up a sweat carrying your luggage up and down. Also, the parking is on a small side-street behind the units and is difficult to find. The owners were in Japan when we stayed, so there was some delay in getting some, not all, responses, but they made every effort to keep in touch, even from a different time zone. We did walk to a nice place (Sissy's) for breakfast, but some places listed on Google had recently closed. Some recommended dinner-places were a short drive. Overall, we greatly enjoyed our overnight and would highly recommend the apartment.

Only negative is no top sheet on the (very comfy) bed and the comforter was far too hot for July.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My son and I enjoyed our stay at Atsuko & Satoru's place. We used it as our home base while exploring the Hudson River Valley. Very spacious, immaculately clean, and exactly as represented in the photos and description on Airbnb.
It is located on the second floor, so if you are traveling with lots of luggage or have difficulty with stairs, you may have an issue navigating the stairway ... it's narrow. It wasn't a problem for us, but I could see how it would be challenging for some folks.
The beds were very comfortable and I loved the duvet in the queen bedroom! So dreamy! The closet in the queen room does not have a light, but I discovered a closet in the living room with fabulous light and a full-length mirror.
The kitchen was well stocked and there was ground coffee, tea, snacks, flavored yogurt, and sparkling water. The kitchen looked well equipped if someone wanted to prepare a meal. Since we hadn't planned on cooking, we found several restaurants and coffee places within easy walking distance.
Although we only stayed for two nights, we could have easily stayed longer since Atsuko & Satoru's place was so lovely, well-appointed, and comfortable!

Such a gorgeous and comfortable Airbnb! Very comfortable beds with lovely linen sheets, cozy pillows, and incredible fluffy towels. Amazing clawfoot tub that has great water pressure and fills up very quickly. Lovely bath amenities such as shampoo, conditioner, body wash. Kitchen had the basics (salt, pepper, olive oil, vinegar) and lots of cookware needed to make meals. Lots of special treats provided such as Harney & Sons teas, Japanese snacks, yogurts and seltzers to make this place feel extra special and luxe.
Amazing location, right next to lots of fun places to visit such as Rough Draft book store and Lola pizzeria. Would definitely come back next time we're in Kingston. Thanks so much for such a thoughtful stay!

review_text:
We had an excellent stay at Atsuko and Satoru's place. There is a class of Airbnbs where you can tell that the hosts really try to go the extra mile and make the stay as comfortable and memorable as possible (rather than just trying to eke out every cent in profit). This is one of those places.
Pros:
- The apartment is super stylish, impeccably clean, and well laid out.
- Location is fantastic and central to downtown. It's on a major street but still very quiet.
- Incredibly well-stocked kitchen with all the essentials and some fun Japanese snacks.
Cons:
- Hard to think of any major issues. If I were to nitpick I'd say the floors are a little squeaky so if you're up early or late you have to be very careful to walk quietly so as not to disturb the downstairs neighbors.
Overall a great stay and I would recommend this place without hesitation.

review_text:
I am writing this review after originally booking 2 nights and after our check out for our original booking.

Because of our wonderful experience at Andrew and Jocelyn's wonderful Air BnB and realizing we needed another night, we decided to reach out to see if we could book another evening here!
This great one bedroom in the heart of Kingston is a perfect getaway for 2. From the moment we arrived to find a bottle of our favorite sparkling water and a delicious chocolate bar, to every communication with this lovely couple, everything was an absolute 5 star experience.
You will find it immaculate! It has a comfortable bed, a roomy shower, a well stocked kitchen, great pottery (made by Andrew) throughout, and a lovely touch by Jocelyn with organic fabrics and her whimsical hand crafted wool art pieces.
Parking is right in front of the entrance, and the carriage house and the cottage extension is a wonderful site to pull up to.
It's a must to book!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This was our 2nd stay at Andrew & Jocelyn's... every bit as wonderful as the first time, almost a yr ago. Coming to the historic house is a pleasure (note that guest accommodations are in an addition to the main building), and the location's is walking distance to Kingston's Stockade District, so great restaurants and shops are all convenient. The best part of every stay, though, comes from the warmth of these two talented artists who are genuinely welcoming. The apartment is very clean and comfortable and contains pieces of Andrew's pottery (I look forward each morning to pouring a cup of French Press coffee into one of the mugs!) and Jocelyn's textile-based artwork. The artists' studios are on site, so hosts are accessible and responsive... but everything is also very quiet for guests (you don't have to interact if you prefer not to). Jocelyn and Andrew provide helpful information about local services and attractions. We have recommended their place to many friends. Great stay!

Its simplicity is its virtue - it has all the essentials for a couple to stay comfortably. The kitchen is well-appointed and everything was clean and worked well (although note there is no microwave if that is important to you). The hosts were communicative and welcomed us with a treat. It was really nice to be able to walk to the uptown area and explore the restaurants there. Kingston is a charming historical town, conveniently located, and this apartment was a great value compared to the options in Rhinebeck. Plus it has its own attractions - e.g., the Hudson River Maritime museum is excellent!

review_text:
My husband Plato and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay! First off, Andrew and Jocelyn are excellent hosts! They are extremely helpful, communicative and easy to reach. Their instructions make it easy to find the place and they ensure that the check in process is smooth and easy as well. We had a slight emergency on our way over which delayed us by hours. Jocelyn went above and beyond to be reassuring and kind and was so helpful as to leave some lights on for us so that we could find our way in easily since we were now arriving in the nighttime. They also made sure to shovel the driveway early in the day the next morning which made it easy to get in and out.
The place itself is well appointed, adorable, comfy and warm! It was a cold and snowy weekend and we were toasty and cozy for our entire stay. It is decorated in a very artsy, “non -cluttery” way that makes it feel bright and airy. It’s so esthetically pleasing that we found ourselves in particularly good moods as we cooked, listened to music and relaxed in the evening. This was definitely a place that is conducive to unwinding and relaxing. I definitely recommend this Airbnb and will be returning again soon.

review_text: We were made to feel very welcome by Andrew & Jocelyn and enjoyed our stay in their apartment, despite having to unexpectedly cut short our trip. The apartment was bright, modern and equipped with everything we needed, and only a short walk from the center of Kingston. One word of warning, the sidewalks are very uneven so it’s probably best to drive or catch a cab into the center after dark. Also, shops close on Tuesdays & Wednesdays and we had some difficulty finding somewhere decent to eat on the Tuesday evening. We did however have a great meal in the Kinsley Hotel restaurant.

,

Stayed about a week
review_text: I think that we can most easily sum up our experience by saying that it was the perfect stay! We booked with Andrew & Jocelyn for a little more than a week over the Memorial Day holiday, taking a few days off and working remote. The Airbnb was in the perfect location in Kingston - super walkable and also a great jumping off point for exploring the area. We appreciated the dedicated spot in the driveway for our car, so that we wouldn't have to worry about street parking for the week. The space itself was laid out perfectly for the two of us - we really enjoyed the small seating area out front. The interior was beautifully appointed - minimal in design so that we felt like we could really relax, free of distraction - spotlessly clean, and had everything that we needed during our visit. Andrew & Jocelyn live & work on the property, so it was really lovely bumping into them on occasion - they were great about communicating with us, but also giving us space to do our own thing. I would without a doubt recommend them as hosts and their Airbnb makes for a wonderful respite in Kingston - we would absolutely stay again. Thanks for having us!

Two, there isn’t a tv in the main living area (there is one in the bedroom) so you won’t be able to eat and watch a movie unless you sit in bed.
Neither of the above items are enough to detract from the overall stay.

The warmth of plywood gave it a Judd feel and the combination of textures added to the sensual, soothing experience. A perfect escape, one we both look forward to returning to. And be sure to check out Pies for the People and Stewart’s ice cream, both nearby.

We were greeted warmly upon arrival as snow began to fall. After a long morning of travel and a glorious nap in maybe the most comfortable bed I’ve ever laid in, I woke up to our hosts shoveling the driveway and removing snow from our car! Examples of this kind of thoughtfulness were noticeable throughout the apartment as well, from the French press to the reading selection to the cool artwork and creative items handmade by our hosts themselves. Thank you for opening your home to us. We certainly hope to return again soon. Cheers!

name: Dana
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
May 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a really chic, really urban apartment. Those from the City or Europe will probably love it. For us Midwesterners, it was a bit sparse. When Spring allergies hit, we had to use toilet paper because there were no kleenex. There were multiple closets with hangers, but no dresser. There was a counter with several stools which was good for a 15 minute breakfast, but made my back hurt for a 2 hour Zoom meeting. We missed having a kitchen table with chairs. The location would be really great on a weekend or in the summer. During the week in Spring, it was deserted with lots of unoccupied buildings and construction. There was two things open -- a good coffee shop and a Mexican restaurant. Everything else was closed. There was a lovely path along the Roundout creek, but it was so deserted that this 40-something woman didn't feel comfortable walking it by herself. I'm sure on a Summer weekend, when more things were open and there were more people around, it would be lovely.

name: Danielle
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Exactly as described. Lovely, clean and in a great spot for strolling, shopping, eating and drinking. The space was plenty large enough for 2 couples, with 2 full bathrooms, and a full size kitchen being clutch. Instant, super hot water and great water pressure. As this is a recently rehabbed building, the furnishings and appliances are all new.
It's my understanding that the Kingston waterfront is hopping in the summer, so this would be a perfect spot to stay during that time, as everything is 1 block away! Parking was readily available either right across the street or just around the corner. Unit 4 is 4 flights up, so be mindful of that if you've got mobility issues.
My only tiny critique is that the bedrooms don't have dressers, just a closet, so we wound up using the deep window sills for the stuff that couldn't get hung up. Not a big deal, just a heads up if you're particular and/or a neat freak and will be staying longer than 2 days, where you'd want to unpack.
Thanks, Corryn!

name: Pavel
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The positives:
- great location, right around the corner from the downtown Kingston waterfront with everything it has to offer;
- perfect communication with the host; great local recommendations;
- easy in and out (electronic locks)
- new (completely rebuilt)
- very spacious, very clean.
- well stocked full kitchen.
The negatives (and I was a bit hesitant to write this):
- this is not a host's fault, but there are constructions everywhere around the place. That did not make the immediate area look nice. If you care about a noise during the day (we did not) it may affect you.
- this is definitely on the host: the apartment is / feels empty. Examples: there are no covered shelves in the entire apartment. There is plenty of space for a dresser under both TVs, but... empty. There is no dining table with chairs; only 3 high chairs at the kitchen counter. Utility closet has no door.
Summary - great place, needs a little investment, but not a luxury accommodation as advertised.

Corryn and her husband texted us back within 5 minutes and immediately gave us the code to the unit below, which was pristine and beautiful. Even though we were not terribly inconvenienced, they gave us a credit which was greatly appreciated and so very professional. The space was clean, modern, and immaculate. We loved our time at the Strand and plan to return.

,

Stayed with kids
review_text:
The Strand House is a great great great location, walkable to nature and shops and restaurants on Broadway.
My husband, 11 month old and I stayed for an entire week while closing on our house in midtown and it was a more than adequate home base. Our friend came to stay for the weekend as well and we all had plenty of space; having two bathrooms was really excellent.
The space is well appointed for the most part, and the beds (let’s face it, the most important part of a good place to stay!) were exceedingly comfortable, as were the pillows, which is rare!
Niggling critiques:
* I kept wishing there was a place to hang your coat by the door, only an issue if you’re staying for a whole week during winter coat season
* nowhere to put your personal toiletries or even a hook to hang washcloth/scrubber inside the shower
* very rough and thin toilet paper for an apartment described as “luxury”
If I wasn’t moving to Kingston, I’d probably book the Strand House again.

The donuts at Half Moon Rondout Cafe are a MUST. It was short drive to great hiking, we got massages at Hutton Brickyard, and drove the few minutes uptown for a dinner at Hotel Kinsley. The space is cute, modern, loved the Nest thermostat. Extremely clean. Easy keyless entry. Would definitely stay again - also cool to check the out on social media @strandhousekingston to see how far the place has come from what it was!

Good wifi and while no parking for the unit, street parking wasn’t hard or inconvenient.
A great choice…would happily stay there again.

review_text:
Beautiful little apartment that was perfect for our weekend getaway! I stayed with a friend to attend the NYS Sheep & Wool Festival and the location was perfect to be able to enjoy all of the different weekend activities that were going on in Rhinebeck, Saugerties, and Kingston. The riverfront is eclectic and fun with plenty of great food options within walking distance.
The apartment had everything that we needed. Cozy living room for evening knitting and movie watching, a full kitchen and two baths for privacy. The beds were very comfortable and everything was super clean.
One thing to be aware of is the on-street parking. Ultimately we were always able to find parking relatively close to the unit for our two vehicles, however, on late evenings it took us a bit of time to find something. Even so, I would absolutely stay here again!

We found the space warm and inviting (and very spacious!). Kingston is a must-see and is very close to many cute small towns and scenic hikes along the Catskills. We will definitely be staying again, thank you Corryn for having us!

Small touches which reflect experienced hosts, a special makeup removing washcloth and super nice roller shades to reduce or increase sunlight through the large and deep beautiful windows. name: Barbara
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2021
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: The Joyce suit is a special place. Spotless and covid safe. Beautifully appointed with lovely tall windows that stream with natural light and offer peeks of the Hudson River we enjoyed making it our home for our week in Kingston. The beds are cozy and comfortable, and the towels soft and plentiful. The kitchen is wells set up for cooking and Corryn welcomes you with a coffee and tea set up, though- I'm a big fan of the doughnuts across the street. The walking location down to the Roundout is perfect. We were able to take advantage of long walks along the river and walking to restaurants which was super nice after tooling around in our car all day. The suite would benefit from a couple of extra blankets for those who prefer more than one, a lamp or two to read by, and an additional table to eat or work at. All in all it was lovely, I hope to spend another week at the Strand soon. Thank you Corryn.

Located in the Rondout district of Kingston, multiple restaurants, boutiques and a stellar wine shop were all within a 5 minute walk from our door.
The historic building's been beautifully remodeled and the beds were super comfortable. In the age of COVID, it was reassuring to see (and smell!) how clean the apartment was upon arrival. We love to cook, and the kitchen had lots of amenities so we could kick back and enjoy at the day's end. We'd definitely recommend #4 to anyone looking to feel at home in lovely Kingston.

name: Maureen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I went to Kingston to visit family, but I wanted to stay in a separate place because of the pandemic. Corryn's place was perfect for my needs. It is located in the Roundout, which is a trendy area by the river with great little boutique shops, restaurants, and a promenade. We ate at the Mariner Restaurant down the street, which has a big outdoor patio, and the seafood and service were excellent. The apartment is exactly as depicted in the pictures. As a senior in a vulnerable age group for COVID, I am really fussy about where I stay these days. Corryn's place literally sparkles with cleanliness that you can see and even smell the minute you walk in the door. The apartment has central AC and ceiling fans, both of which work great and keep the apartment comfortable even on hot days. The beds are super comfortable, and all the basic amenities are there. You do need to walk up a few flights of stairs to reach the apartment, but I had no problem and appreciated being on the top floor. Although there is no desk, I used my compluter comfortably while sitting on the high stool at the kitchen island. I loved all the natural light in the apartment. The only downside is that the windows are set so that they open only about 3 inches, which is a consideration if you prefer fresh air over AC. Corryn is a true superhost who takes health and safety seriously and responds promptly to questions. All in all, a terrific place to stay!

My husband, mom, 6 month old daughter and I enjoyed our stay. Checkin was easy. We stayed in unit 4 and had an ample amount of space, with the 2 bedrooms and 2 baths. We were able to enjoy our own meals as well with a stocked kitchen and thoughtful touches such as creamer and straws. Location is great and it was easy to find parking across the street. Unit 4 is a few flights up the stairs so if you have a lot of stuff like us, it will take a few trips from the car, but it was no big deal.
The kitchen sink was leaking when in use and Corryn was communicative and offered to have it fixed but since it was a slow drip, we asked if it could be fixed after we left to which she agreed.
Overall highly recommend this Airbnb. Super clean, great location and helpful host. Wish our stay could have been longer.

I cannot say enough good things about the Strand House. The location is absolutely amazing -- in such a quaint part of Kingston right along the water. There were so many great restaurants just steps away and everyone in the town couldn't have been kinder. Corryn and her husband were amazing hosts who always made sure we were well taken care of and were always prompt when answering our questions.
When you walk into your suite you can immediately tell that Corryn put her heart and soul into the apartment and made sure to recognize the history of Kingston while doing so. My boyfriend and I are truly grateful we stumbled upon this gem and are already in the process of scheduling our next visit.

review_text: A creative's dream building - an old historic factory-like structure renovated into modern open-space apartments. We were hesitant to travel with the Covid issue, but this was the perfect choice. It's a no-contact check-in and with only a few units, you don't see or hear others... there's a full kitchen, which is essential with the lockdown. We stayed in #4: vaulted ceilings, tons of windows and light, historic/unique elements, modern design, free movies etc. Kingston is charming and close enough to NYC - we got our fill of cute town + nature. The Strand is around the corner from one of the town's main drags and waterfront and close to parks, the beach etc. Corryn's communication is frequent and helpful. You won't find another airbnb (or hotel room) like this. It's a gem - just go.

She ventured out to dine and the people in the area could not have been nicer. An elderly couple who sat across but whom she did not speak with at her at Ship to Shore picked up her tab for dinner. The waiter said that they were just nice regulars.The whole community was very hospitable and she really enjoyed her time in Kingston. This place is in a great location and is perfect for time away for the city to relax or if you are in Kingston on business.

rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Theresa was super communicative and her place is in a great location!
With a little love this could be a 5 star place but we had a 3 star stay.
The sofabed metal frame was broken so we couldn't use it. No problem, the air mattress was right there and easy to find...but my daughter woke up on an air-less mattress. Basically both were broken, thank goodness 5 year olds don't care about sleeping on the floor.
I'm also 95% positive the real beds are double beds, not queen as advertised. When we travel my toddler ends up in our bed I. the wee hour of the mornings sometimes, so a double bed is tough.
The place was clean but just a bit dusty. I had put some stuff on the bottom shelf of the coffee table and taken it out....covered in dust.
All that being said - the location is excellent, the host is super responsive, and if the bed situation gets fixed it sleeps a lot of people! Uptown Kingston is so great and there are 3 amazing coffee shops within one block.

review_text: What a unique space! The space consists of two big floors above a shop on a main street in Kingston. Spacious is an understatement! We were right in the middle of everything, which was very convenient. I'm very into history so as soon as I could, I checked out the history of this building, which used to be a furniture store, clothing store, etc. through the years. Everything was clean, comfortable, and cozy. My only complaint has nothing to do with Theresa and is my own gripe about the lack of historical preservation. At some point in time, siding was used to cover the big, beautiful front picture window on the third floor. You still have the natural lighting from the back windows, so that's not an issue. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this space and this town! Thank you, Theresa!!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Love the town of Kingston. Lots of things to do eat, and this Airbnb is right in the heart of it all. Couldn't ask for a better location. Check in was super easy and the apartment is not hard to find. For parking the host has great instructions- we just did street parking for overnight and added coins to the meter at 9am every day since we found good spots right out front. Our car was safe both nights as well. I had a few questions for Theresa and she was always responsive and helpful which was much appreciated. The airbnb is huge and the kitchen is stocked with appliances, utensils etc. There was ever coffee, tea, and condiments for our use. The 2nd floor is a great hang out spot. The heating/ cooling units were effective too (we came on a cold and rainy weekend so we needed the heat). The only thing I would note (and that Theresa mentions in the airbnb description) is that the floor boards and stairs DO creak with every step. If you're a light sleeper then bring some ear plugs, nbd!

review_text: Theresa really is a super host. My 5 friends and I were stranded going home when our car broke down and we were fortunate to come across Theresa’s loft last minute. I was surprised and grateful that she responded within minutes to all my questions. The loft was fantastic, spacious, clean and had everything we needed. Our disaster car ride turned in to a mini girls weekend in this lovely space and town. The location was perfect especially since we didn’t have a car anymore. Plenty of shops and great restaurants in quick walking distance in this cute small town. We were even more grateful for Theresa’s flexibility with our unknown plans for staying. Both her and the loft were amazing. Maybe we will plan to come back and stay here again, but this time on purpose!

review_text: Four Medicare eligible buddies biking from Albany to NYC. What do we want in an AirBnB? 1) hot shower with towels, soap and shampoo - check. 2) comfortable beds - check. 3) WiFi - check. 4) cleanliness - check 5) parking - parked car out front $1 an hour from 3 till 6, free from 6 till 9 AM - check. 6) walkable restaurants - plenty in the area - check. 7) walkable breakfast - Dietz Stadium Diner 2 blocks away was great - check. So in sum it was great - completely met our needs. It also has a full kitchen which we didn’t use. Very spacious - I think a yoga studio - could have played pickleball in it - though not recommended.

Great place! Good for groups who don't mind not having a ton of privacy, due to the open floor plan. We stayed here to attend a wedding at Senate Garage and it was PERFECT, literally a block away from the venue.
I will mention that the wood floors are very creaky, so if you're a super light sleeper and are with people who use the bathroom a lot, you might get woken up a few times during the night. Wasn't really a problem for us, but it might bother some people.
Theresa was very responsive and was even kind enough to let us check in an hour early. Everything we needed - sheets, towels, shower supplies - was available to us in abundance. A super painless rental experience overall.

review_text: Such a cool place! Probably our favorite accommodations on this trip. Tons of space, lots of character, comfortable, really well equipped. Part of me has always wanted to live in a loft so I got to have a taste here. Theresa is great to deal with, and everything went perfectly. Ideal location for Kingston, right smack in the middle of the nicest part with the most restaurants and shops. Shout outs to Diego's Taqueria for feeding us delicious dinner when most places were closed (Tue-Wed is limited, as in many towns along the HVA) and the Stockade Tavern (fun staff, great atmosphere, wonderful cocktails). I can't think of any suggestions to improve the place. Note this an old building with steep stairs to get up (it's on the 2nd and 3rd floors), so not a great choice if you have mobility issues. Otherwise - this is the place to stay in Kingston for sure!

name: Kevin
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
December 2021
,
·
Group trip
review_text: Location. Location. Location. If you want to be in the heart of the stockade district, you can't do any better than this. You will have to be good at stairs as this old building has very high ceilings. It is two full floors from the front to the back of the building; both are completely open except for the one bathroom. Lots of space but only two portable screens for privacy. There is one bed & one pullout couch on each of the levels. The second level pull out has memory foam and is comfortable. The kitchen is on the top level and should be fine if you choose not to enjoy one of the very close restaurants or diners. It looks to have all the necessary tools. We only had one breakfast there. There is good table that can accommodate 6. Unloading your vehicle can be a little tricky if traffic is busy. On street parking is metered as is the public lot down the street during daytime hours. If arriving by bus,, you are three blocks down the street and the last block has covered sidewalks. Summary: right in the middle of the Stockade area but no street noise on our stay. Loft style open accommodation with quite a few stairs. Close to Trailways bus station.

review_text: The loft is big and clean with a lovely view from the rooftop. Located on a main street yet super quiet. Theresa was a lovely host and even allowed a late check in. Shopping and food was right outside our door or just a short walk away. Kingston was super cute and historic.

name: Jason
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I really enjoyed my stay! Having the second and third floor really made for a quiet and relaxing week. Almost no street noise, and everything uptown just steps away. Also appreciated the third floor AC units. It was HOT for a couple days that I was there, but very comfortable inside. I would definitely recommend it if you're looking for a cozy space that's close to everything. Just keep the two staircases in mind if you are traveling with older (or very young) guests. I did a lot of up and down over the course of a week. Burned my vacation calories :) I also ended up just paying $20 for a monthly parking pass. Worth it to have my car right there and not worry about coming and going. Overall it was a great time.

name: Yushiro
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
May 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Great loft in the historic area of Kingston. Large supermarket near by and a VERY good bakery next door. The space was very clean, spacious and Teresa was very responsive.
Few things the guest should know is that the spaces don't have any doors or walls separating the 2 bedrooms, living room, and dining space, so you basically have to walk though a bedroom to get to a bathroom on 2nd floor. The stair and the flooring was very squeaky, so that's the only thing we had a bit of tough time with at night.
Other than that, we had a great time.
